title: Apostle Courses
content:
Apostle Courses

Apostle Intro Course

The Four Apostles Online Course

Discover the Unique Expressions of the Apostolic Gifting

Not all apostles are the same. The Four Apostles online course explores the unique and overlapping characteristics of four different types of apostles — the Frontrunner, Frontliner, Advancer, and Ambassador. With biblical case studies, real-life insights, and practical tools, you’ll gain clarity on your apostolic calling or how to recognize and support others in theirs.

Taught by APEST specialist Tim Catchim, this course is ideal for anyone seeking a deeper, more practical understanding of apostolic ministry in today’s Church.

45 min Duration Self-Paced Price: $14.99

What You'll Get Access To:

  • Engaging video format with lifetime access
  • Insightful tools, diagrams, and visuals to enhance learning and understanding
  • Downloadable resources to share with and present to others
  • Special discounts for other APEST courses
Enroll Now
View Full Course Description
  • Group course via Zoom
  • 3 Weeks · 3 Sessions - 1 hour each
  • Interactice small group format
  • Limited to 8 participants
  • Activation exercises
  • Downloadable resources
  • Accessible on phone and computer
  • Full access to presentation slides with notes
  • $24.99
Reserve Your Spot

The Four Apostles

The Four Apostles Online Course

Discover the Unique Expressions of the Apostolic Gifting

Not all apostles are the same. The Four Apostles online course explores the unique and overlapping characteristics of four different types of apostles — the Frontrunner, Frontliner, Advancer, and Ambassador.

Taught by APEST specialist Tim Catchim, this course is ideal for anyone seeking a deeper, more practical understanding of apostolic ministry in today’s Church.

45 min Duration Self-Paced Price: $14.99

By the end of this course you'll be able to...

  • Identify the core traits common to all apostles.
  • Differentiate between the four types of apostles: Frontrunner, Frontliner, Advancer, and Ambassador.
  • Recognize how each type of apostle contributes to the expansion of the church’s mission.
  • Apply biblical insights and contemporary examples to the four types of apostles.
  • Discern which type of apostle best reflects your own gifting, or those you know.
  • Utilize tools and visuals to better communicate apostolic concepts to those in your ministry context.
  • Develop practical strategies for supporting different types of apostles.

What You'll Get Access To:

  • Engaging video format with lifetime access
  • Insightful tools, diagrams, and visuals to enhance learning and understanding
  • Downloadable resources to share with and present to others
  • Special discounts for other APEST courses
Enroll Now

Frequently Asked Questions

Questions about our Apostle Courses.

Who are the courses for?

Our courses are customized for a diverse range of individuals. Whether you’re an everyday Christian looking to understand more about the aposlte gifting, a small group or ministry leader, or a leader of a church, church plant, or non-profit, our tailored learning experiences are designed with you in mind.

How do I choose the right online course for me?

If you’re just beginning to explore the aposlte gifting, the Apostle Intro course is a great place to start. It lays a solid biblical and conceptual foundation without assuming any prior knowledge. From there, the “Building the Apostle Within” series (101, 201, 301, and 401) is designed as a developmental pathway — guiding you from basic, to intermediate, to advanced, to adaptive skill levels. Each course builds on the last, offering practical tools, real-world insight, and activation exercises to help you strengthen your apostle within.

If you’re looking to understand the unique ways apostle giting can be expressed, The Four Apostles course is a great companion to help you discern your own apostolic type and how it can plays out in your life and ministry.

To help you make an informed decision, we provide a detailed explanation of each course. Just click the “View Full Course Description” and check it out.  

Can I skip a course if I already have experience?

Yes. While the courses are designed to build on one another, you’re free to start at the level Intor, 101, 201 etc.) that best matches your current understanding and experience. If you already have a solid grasp of the apostolic gifting or are actively functioning in apostolic ministry, starting with 201 or even 301 might be a better fit. You can review the course descriptions to help you choose the entry point for where you are in your journey.

Do I have to take the courses in order?

Not necessarily. The “Building the Apostle Within” series is designed as a developmental pathway, but each course is self-contained and can be taken independently. That said, the learning experience will be more coherent if you go through the sequence progressively — especially if you’re just getting started in your aposlte journey or looking for long term development. 

Are the courses pre recorded or “live”?

Most of the courses are group coaching calls via Zoom. But we also offer on-demand video courses, too. Each course is identified accordingly in the description.

Can I take your courses at my own pace?

Absolutely! Our on-demand video courses are designed for your convenience, allowing you to learn at your own pace. We understand that everyone has different schedules and learning styles, so our courses are flexible to fit your individual needs. This is ideal for fitting your courses into your personal and professional life. However, the group coaching courses via Zoom are “live” and have scheduled elements, which are clearly indicated in the course description.

Is there a deadline to complete an online course?

While our on-demand video courses are self-paced, they typically come with a recommended timeframe for completion to keep you on track, depending on the course. However, to accommodate different learning speeds and schedules you will have access to all course material for the lifetime of your account. This will allow you to come back to courses and materials and access the content anytime you want.  

What is the refund policy for courses?

We stand by the quality of our courses, but we also understand that circumstances can change. Our refund policy is designed to be fair and transparent. Please refer to our ‘Terms and Conditions‘ for detailed information on refunds.

Can I interact with instructors or other students in the online courses?

Most courses are offered in an online small group format to facilitate interactive learning and discussion among participatns. However, the on-demand video courses are pre-recorded to allow for self-paced learning.

To encourage ongoing interaction and learning, everyone who enrolls in a course will be invited to join a private Facebook Group where you can connect, ask questions, and share insights with others who have been or are currently enrolled in a course, along with other instructors.

What if I encounter technical issues while taking a course?

We are dedicated to making sure your learning experience is enjoyable and meaningful. If you encounter any issues, you can reach out to us via email or our website’s contact form and we will seek to resolve it in the quickest and most efficient way possible.

Are there any prerequisites for enrolling in online courses?

Some of the series courses like “Developing the Apostle Within” may have prerequisites, which are clearly listed in the course description. However, the Intro and Four Apostles courses are designed so that anyone can step in and move forward in their APEST journey without any prior reading or experience.

What kind of practical experience will I gain from these courses?

Our courses are designed with a strong emphasis on practical, hands-on learning and skills development. You’ll not only be introduced to paradigm shifting content, each course will include practical exercises you can do to apply APEST right where you live, learn, work, and play.

Is there a trial period for online courses?

While we don’t offer a trial period, we provide detailed course descriptions so you can understand the course content and structure before making a commitment.

After completing a course, can I get ongoing support or resources?

Yes, definitely! Completing a course doesn’t mean the end of your APEST journey with us. Everyone who participates in a course is invited to join a private Facebook Group where you can connect, share insights, and grow together with others in their APEST journey. 

For those who want more focused investment, you can enroll in our Co-Lab where APEST practitioners and equippers meet bi-weekly for ongoing coaching and consulting with Tim on how to maximize APEST in their context. See Coaching at the top of the page for more details.
